Generic pictures of SGX

site_title: Ford to boost EV part investment for UK plant by £149m
summary: Ford is investing £149m in its UK Halewood plant to boost electric vehicle (EV) part production capacity by 70%. The investment will increase production to 420,000 units annually, starting in 2024, and marks the company's push to go electric. Ford aims to supply 70% of its 600,000 EVs sold in Europe by 2026, ahead of the EU's plan to ban new fossil-fuel passenger cars by 2035. The move is part of Ford's £380m investment to transition its combustion engine factory to EV parts production.

site_title: CPF interest pegs: Government watching rate environment closely
summary: The Singapore government will continue to monitor the interest rate environment to ensure the relevance of CPF interest rate pegs. The CPF interest rate for members aged 55 and above will remain unchanged, but those aged 55+ will earn an extra 2% interest on the first $20,000 and 1% on the next $30,000 of their combined balances. The interest rate for Ordinary Accounts and Special and MediSave Accounts remains unchanged, with the floor rate at 2.5% and 4% respectively.

images.alt_text: CPFboard.jpg
CPF could be on the brink of adjusting Special Account interest rates, as 10-year Singapore government bond yields have climbed to more than 3.1 per cent

site_title: FTX contagion has hints of 2008 global financial crisis – and that is bad news for Bitcoin
summary: The cryptocurrency market is experiencing a contagion crisis, reminiscent of the 2008 global financial crisis, which could lead to the collapse of Bitcoin. The crisis began with the collapse of TerraUSD, a stablecoin, and spread to other cryptocurrencies, including FTX, which filed for bankruptcy. The lack of regulation and oversight in the crypto industry has led to a "mad rush" of clients desperate to withdraw their funds, similar to the bank runs seen in 2007 and 2008. Experts warn that if major players such as Binance go under, there may be no safe harbors left in the cryptocurrency world, threatening the survival of Bitcoin.

images.alt_text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the collapsed crypto exchange FTX, speaks to Andrew Ross Sorkin virtually at The New York Times’ DealBook Summit 2022 in Manhattan on Nov 30, 2022.
Italy’s stricter stance comes after Portugal in October unveiled its plan to tax short-term gains on digital assets at 28 per cent.
Kraken had recently expanded quickly, and the cuts will return its workforce to where it was a year ago.

site_title: World Bank lays out US$1.5t green cooling plan for India
summary: The World Bank has proposed a $1.5 trillion green cooling plan for India over the next two decades to combat severe heat waves and reduce carbon dioxide-equivalent emissions by 200 million tons annually by 2040. The plan focuses on cooling homes and commercial buildings, and recommends supporting energy-efficient fan and air conditioner manufacturing, as well as affordable financing for customers. The initiative aims to address the country's high dependence on heat-exposed labor, protect public health, and mitigate productivity losses due to extreme temperatures.

images.alt_text: Fishermen on the water as smoke rises from chimneys at the Suralaya coal power plant in Cilegon. A US$20b deal was announced on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Nov 2022 to wean Indonesia off coal.

site_title: Indonesia November inflation cools further but stays above target
summary: Indonesia's annual core inflation rate decreased to 3.30% in November, but the headline inflation rate remained at 5.42%, exceeding the central bank's target range for the sixth consecutive month. Rising fuel, air fare, and transportation costs contributed to the inflation. Bank Indonesia plans to maintain a front-loaded interest rate policy to control inflation, aiming to steer core inflation back into its target range within the first half of 2023.

images.alt_text: Indonesia has a target of at least 1.2 million electric bike adoptions and 35,000 electric car adoptions by 2024.

site_title: Digital Core Reit to acquire 25% stake in Frankfurt asset on full debt funding
summary: Digital Core Reit will acquire a 25% stake in a Frankfurt data centre on full debt funding, abandoning plans to acquire a majority interest in the facility. The deal, valued at $146 million, is expected to close by end-2022 and is distribution per unit accretive by around 2%. This decision comes after the Reit's manager deemed the debt-funded option more attractive than the larger deal alternative, which would have increased the portfolio value by 43% to $2 billion.

images.alt_text: Digital Core Reit misses forecasts for distributable income for first 9 months of 2022
CapitaLand Ascendas Reit is acquiring a cold storage logistics facility in Singapore for S$191.9 million.
The manager of Digital Core Reit has proposed to acquire the data centre property located at 1215 Integrity Drive in Richardson, Texas.
T

site_title: Hong Kong court delays media mogul’s national security trial
summary: A Hong Kong court has delayed the trial of media mogul Jimmy Lai, who faces a possible life sentence on foreign collusion charges. The trial was originally set to begin on December 1, but was adjourned to December 13 due to a request from the government to bar Lai's UK lawyer from representing him. China is considering a request to bar overseas lawyers from national security cases, which could set a precedent for the interpretation of the national security law without public debate or a vote by Hong Kong's legislature.

images.alt_text: Lai, 75, faces a possible life sentence if he is convicted of colluding with foreign forces in a trial that is scheduled to start on Thursday.

Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai being escorted into a Hong Kong Correctional Services van outside the Court of Final Appeal in February 2021. He had been ordered to remain in jail while judges consider his fresh bail application.
Hong Kong independent news outlet shuts down to 'ensure safety'

site_title: Fed’s chief jawboner to let data do the talking
summary: US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled a shift in approach, indicating that policymakers will downshift from rapid tightening as soon as next month's meeting, allowing data to drive the narrative. Powell acknowledged uncertainty and the need for a more nuanced approach, citing the need for economic growth to run below its trend, supply chains to heal, and a cooling labor market. This move was met with a positive reaction from markets, with the S&P 500 Index reaching its highest closing level since September 12 and 10-year Treasury bond yields falling 11 basis points.

images.alt_text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished higher 2.2 per cent at 34,589.77 on Wednesday, an increase of nearly 740 points.

site_title: UK house prices fall more sharply after mortgage costs jump
summary: UK house prices have fallen 1.4% in November, the second decline in two months, and the fastest drop since June 2020. Excluding the pandemic, prices have not fallen this sharply since the global financial crisis over a decade ago. The cost of home loans has soared above 6% due to the Bank of England's benchmark lending rate increase and concerns about slowing growth and rising government debt. Housing affordability has become stretched, and homebuyers may have to pay an average of 5% to take out a mortgage through 2028, with a 9% drop in house prices anticipated over the next two years.

images.alt_text: Michael Fox rents a 130-foot Dutch barge with two bedrooms, a bathroom, a galley and a lounge with a retractable glass roof.
The BOE figures show the average rate on new mortgage loans increased by 25 basis points in October to 3.09 per cent.
To boost the City’s global competitiveness, Britain’s finance ministry promises a “Big Bang 2.0” shake-up of financial rules.

site_title: China set to ease Covid curbs after protests
summary: China's top Covid official, Vice-Premier Sun Chunlan, has signaled a possible relaxation of the country's strict zero-tolerance approach to the virus, following nationwide protests calling for an end to lockdowns and greater political freedom. The protests, sparked by a deadly fire in Urumqi and widespread discontent, have led to local authorities easing restrictions and relaxing rules. Analysts believe this could signal a shift towards a "living with Covid" stance, as China considers ending its stringent zero-Covid policy.

images.alt_text: Workers at Foxconn’s iPhone factory in Zhengzhou clashing with riot police. Now most parts of the city are seeing lockdowns lifted in line with calls for a more targeted approach.
TOPSHOT - A protester shouts during a protest for the victims of a deadly fire as well as a protest against China's harsh Covid-19 restrictions in Beijing on Nov 28, 2022

site_title: New home prices in China fall further in November: survey
summary: China's new home prices fell for a sixth consecutive month in November, with 57 cities reporting lower prices than in October. The decline was 0.06% from October, and is attributed to pandemic-control lockdowns hindering sales. The government has introduced measures to ease the industry's liquidity crunch, but experts predict a shortage of buyers will hinder full recovery. New home prices are expected to fall in the first half of next year before rising for the whole of 2023.

images.alt_text: Residents confront workers donned in protective suits who are blocking the entrance of a residential compound amid a Covid-19 outbreak in Shanghai, China, Nov 30, 2022.

site_title: Asia’s factory activity shrinks as China lockdown impact widens
summary: Asia's factory activity shrank in November due to China's strict Covid-19 lockdowns and slowing global demand. China's factory activity contracted, and other export-reliant economies, including Japan and South Korea, also saw declines. Vietnam and Indonesia also experienced contractions, while India's factory activity expanded at its fastest pace in three months. The lockdowns have disrupted international supply and heightened fears of a further economic slump in Asia, with economists warning of mounting downside risks to China's economic growth in the fourth quarter.

site_title: Australia and New Zealand housing tumble down under as soaring borrowing costs take toll
summary: Australia and New Zealand are experiencing a reversal of pandemic-era property booms due to soaring borrowing costs. Housing prices in both countries have fallen, with New Zealand's home values dropping 2.9% and Australia's falling 3.2% from a year ago, according to CoreLogic data. Central banks are raising interest rates to control inflation, leading economists to predict further price drops, with some expecting a decline of over 20% from peaks.

images.alt_text: Data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics on Thursday showed private capital spending fell a real 0.6 per cent in the September quarter from the previous quarter, missing forecasts of a 1.5 per cent increase.

site_title: SpaceX postpones Japanese moon lander launch again
summary: SpaceX has postponed the launch of Japan's private lunar lander, Hakuto-R Mission 1, due to additional pre-flight checks. The launch, originally scheduled for December 1, has been delayed, with a new target date to be shared once confirmed. The lander, carrying a 10-kg rover named Rashid, aims to touch down on the Moon's surface in April 2023. This marks the first private lunar mission by Japan, with ispace's CEO, Takeshi Hakamada, stating that the project has made significant progress since its conceptualization in 2016.

images.alt_text: SpaceX dominates the market for commercial space launch.
SpaceX plans to offer Starlink Internet connectivity to Hawaiian Airlines planes next year.
Freedom began its stay in orbit on Apr 27.

site_title: New York’s best wine bars
summary: New York's best wine bars have been identified, offering a unique blend of wine and food. Gem Wine, Gem Wine, and Ten Bells Bushwick in Manhattan and Brooklyn are notable examples, with Gem Wine featuring a small communal space and no wine list, while Ten Bells Bushwick offers a dark and moody atmosphere. Other notable wine bars include Place des Ftes in Brooklyn, which offers a list of mostly Spanish natural wines, and pure New York food. These establishments showcase the evolving definition of a great wine bar, providing a unique experience for wine enthusiasts.

images.alt_text: Decadent new ways to imbibe this festive season’s bounty.

site_title: Conference organisers expected to measure events’ waste, emissions by next year
summary: Singapore aims to require meeting, incentives, conference, and exhibition (Mice) event organizers to measure waste and carbon emissions by next year. The Mice Sustainability Roadmap, launched by the Singapore Tourism Board and the Singapore Association of Convention and Exhibition Organisers and Suppliers, aims to push the industry towards more sustainable alternatives. The plan focuses on reducing waste generated by exhibitor booths, with the goal of creating a more environmentally friendly Mice industry in Singapore.

images.alt_text: This year's Singapore Grand Prix may inform and aid Singapore in developing better models for less-carbon-intensive affairs in the future.  (PHOTO: AFP)

As the events industry returns to an in-person format, organisers must be accountable for their impact on the environment, says Jen Teo, executive director of the Singapore Environment Council. (PHOTO: SEC)

site_title: Hong Kong: Stocks surge more than 3% at open
summary: Hong Kong stocks surged more than 3% at the open on Thursday, following Federal Reserve chief Jerome Powell's comments that the US central bank would slow down interest rate hikes. The Hang Seng Index jumped 3.22% to 19,196.07, with Shanghai and Shenzhen Composite Indexes also gaining. The rally follows hopes that China will ease Covid containment measures, which have impacted the economy. Investors welcomed Powell's comments, which suggest a slowdown in interest rate hikes, contributing to a global rally in markets.

site_title: Freehold building in Farrer Park up for sale with S$16.88m guide price
summary: A six-storey freehold building in Farrer Park has been put up for sale via expression of interest with a guide price of S$16.88 million. The building sits on a 2,003 sq ft land plot and features a ground floor commercial unit, residential units, and a private car park. The property is within walking distance of the Little India conservation area and major transportation hubs. Demand for properties in the Farrer Park vicinity has been healthy, with recent sales exceeding expectations. The expression of interest exercise will close on Jan 17, 2023.

images.alt_text: According to a report by Propnex on Wednesday (Oct 26), the median rental for shophouses stood at S$5.65 psf per month in Q3, up from S$5.50 psf per month last quarter.
Real estate agency Huttons noted that investors are shifting their focus to shophouses in Joo Chiat, Kampong Glam and Jalan Basar (pictured above), especially as price resistance sets in.
City Developments Limited (CDL) and MCL Land has launched its 407-unit condominium Piccadilly Grand, with previews starting Saturday (Apr 23) and sales booking scheduled for 2 weeks later on May 7.

site_title: Asia: Stocks join global rally and dollar drops on Fed rate joy
summary: Asian stocks surged on Thursday, led by Hong Kong and tech giants Alibaba and Tencent, as Federal Reserve boss Jerome Powell signaled a slowdown in interest rate hikes. The dollar fell, and global markets rallied in anticipation of a softer approach to fighting Covid in China. Powell's remarks hinted at a 50-basis-point rate increase in December, but also indicated that policy would remain tight for some time to restore price stability. The gains extended November's rally, helping to claw back losses suffered in 2022, and investors are now optimistic about a sustainable bull market.

site_title: Former leader Jiang’s body arrives in Beijing as China mourns
summary: Former Chinese leader Jiang Zemin's body arrived in Beijing ahead of a public memorial service. A special flight carrying his remains from Shanghai, where he died on November 30 due to leukemia and multiple organ failure, was met by President Xi Jinping. A public memorial service is scheduled for Tuesday at Beijing's Great Hall of the People.

images.alt_text: Former Chinese President Jiang Zemin died from leukemia and multiple organ failure in Shanghai at 12.13 pm, the official Xinhua news agency said.

site_title: MetaComp gets MAS licence for digital payment token services
summary: MetaComp, a Singapore-based digital asset exchange, has obtained a license from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) to provide digital payment token services. The license, effective December 2022, enables MetaComp to offer a suite of digital asset services to corporates and institutional investors. MetaComp's CEO and co-founder, Dr. Bo Bai, stated that the license will imbue greater trust and integrity in Singapore's digital asset industry, allowing institutions to confidently enter the sector.

images.alt_text: MAS reiterates the hazards of cryptocurrency trading for the general public in its response to queries on FTX's operations in Singapore.
Once granted, the CMS licence will allow Custody Plus to provide custodial services for capital market products, including tokenised securities.

The interconnected collapses of companies including hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (above) and platforms Zipmex, Hodlnaut and Vauld have highlighted the lack of extensive risk management rules for digital asset companies.
Crypto investors and users of insolvent crypto platforms likely will have to hang tight as these companies work out a turnaround plan under a debt moratorium.
Hodlnaut is aiming to avoid a forced liquidation of its assets, which would require it to sell users’ cryptocurrencies at depressed prices.

site_title: Tesla to issue software updates for 435,000 cars in China over marker light issue
summary: Tesla is issuing a software update for 435,000 vehicles in China to fix a marker light issue that could lead to a collision. The update affects 142,277 Model 3 cars and 292,855 Model Ys. This is the second recall in recent weeks, following a recall of over 80,000 Model S, Model X, and Model 3 cars for software and seat belt issues. The update will be delivered via an over-the-air update and is a response to regulatory concerns.

site_title: Sri Lanka hopes for tourism revival with 1.5 million arrivals next year
summary: Sri Lanka aims to attract 1.5 million tourists next year, hoping to generate $5 billion in foreign exchange, which could aid in its financial recovery. The country, known for its beaches, temples, and tea, has been struggling to pay for essential imports due to a lack of foreign exchange. Tourism Minister Harin Fernando believes tourism can play a key role in Sri Lanka's recovery, and the government is working to increase tourist arrivals.

images.alt_text: The troubled South Asian economy has raised borrowing costs by 950 basis points this year that took the key rate to 15.5 per cent as inflation bolted to become Asia’s fastest.

site_title: BOJ policymaker vows to keep ultra-low rates until wages perk up
summary: BOJ board member Asahi Noguchi stated that the central bank will keep interest rates ultra-low until Japan achieves its 2% inflation target in a sustainable manner. Japan's consumer prices have risen sharply due to rising imported goods prices, but domestic trend inflation remains at low levels. Noguchi emphasized that monetary policy decisions should focus on domestic macro-economic factors rather than external inflationary pressures. This stance maintains the BOJ as an outlier among global central banks tightening monetary policy to combat inflation.

images.alt_text: The BOJ governor has stuck doggedly to rock-bottom interest rates, even as global peers hiked, in a drive to generate lasting growth in prices and the economy through a cycle of rising wages.
Haruhiko Kuroda has repeatedly called for the BOJ to keep monetary policy ultra-loose.

site_title: Philippines needs to find ways to exploit South China Sea resources, says Marcos
summary: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. emphasizes the country's right to exploit energy reserves in the disputed South China Sea, even without a deal with China. Despite talks being terminated due to sovereignty issues, Marcos suggests exploring other ways to access resources without a government-to-government deal. The Philippines relies heavily on imported fuel, making energy security a priority. Marcos also plans to announce new developments on US proposals to access Philippine military bases by early next year.

images.alt_text: US Vice-President Kamala Harris speaks with members of the press, before departing Don Mueang International Airport for the Philippines, in Bangkok, Thailand, Nov 20, 2022.

The encounter between the Chinese and Philippine officials in the South China Sea happened during US Vice-President Kamala Harris' visit in the country. Her trip included a stop on Palawan, an island on the edge of the South China Sea, to reaffirm the US' support for a 2016 tribunal ruling that invalidated China's claims on the disputed waterway.

site_title: UOB ups ante in deposit battle with rate hike on One savings account to 7.8%
summary: UOB has raised the interest rate on its flagship savings account, One Account, to 7.8% per annum, the highest in its seven-year history. The new rate applies to balances between $75,000 and $100,000, with customers required to spend at least $500 on an eligible UOB card and credit their salary of over $1,600 via Giro. This move follows similar rate hikes by rival banks DBS and OCBC, as the banks compete for deposits to lower funding costs.

images.alt_text: HSBC said it will invest tens of millions of pounds in updating and improving its remaining 327 branches.

The study was conducted over the past two years on the financial models of Commonwealth Bank of Australia, National Australia Bank, Westpac Banking Corp, Australia and New Zealand Banking Group, and Macquarie Group.

site_title: TSMC plans to make more advanced chips in US at urging of Apple
summary: TSMC plans to manufacture advanced 4-nanometre chips at its new US$12 billion plant in Arizona, starting in 2024, in response to US customers like Apple. The move will allow major tech companies to source more chips from the US, reducing reliance on Taiwan. The plant will also produce 3-nanometre chips, with Apple expected to use about a third of the output. The development comes amid efforts to bring manufacturing to the US and Europe, driven by supply-chain disruptions and trade tensions with China.

images.alt_text: Foxconn said in a statement that Chiang Shang-yi had been appointed its semiconductor strategy officer, a newly created role.

TSMC founder Morris Chang, who was speaking on Saturday (Nov 19) as Taiwan’s special envoy at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in Bangkok, says the cost of making chips in Arizona may be at least 50 per cent higher than in Taiwan, but that did not prevent the company from moving more of its production to the US

site_title: LMS Compliance caps Catalist debut at S$0.27, 3.9% above IPO price
summary: LMS Compliance, a Malaysia-based testing and certification services provider, made its trading debut on the Catalist board of the Singapore Exchange (SGX) at S$0.27, 3.9% above its initial public offering (IPO) price of S$0.26 per share. The company raised S$3.64 million through the sale of 14 million shares, with a market capitalisation of S$22.7 million at listing. Approximately 950,000 shares were traded on the first day of trading.

images.alt_text: As at Sep 16, LMS Compliance offers more than 1,100 accredited tests and 10,200 non-accredited tests to customers from industries like food, medical devices and pharmaceuticals.

site_title: Singapore residents’ real median income growth rises to 2.1% in 2022
summary: Singapore's real median income growth rose to 2.1% in 2022, outpacing inflation, according to the Ministry of Manpower. This is slower than the pre-Covid years, when real median income growth averaged 3.8% from 2014 to 2019. Despite this, unemployment rates for professionals and managers fell to 2.6% and 4.4% for non-PMETs, while discouraged workers and underemployment rates also decreased. The government expects real median income growth to remain stable, with wage growth exceeding inflation in the next year.

images.alt_text: Singapore employment rises 75,600 in Q3 but momentum may be easing
Hiring weakness has been spotted in sectors like manufacturing and infrastructure, said recruiters.
Some sectors are already seeing the early effects of slowing demand. Hiring activity has started to cool in the red-hot sectors of tech and manufacturing, for instance.

site_title: Mark Zuckerberg says Apple App Store rules a ‘conflict of interest’
summary: Mark Zuckerberg criticized Apple's App Store policies, calling them a "conflict of interest" due to the vast majority of mobile profits going to Apple. Zuckerberg echoed billionaire Elon Musk's concerns about Apple's fees and restrictions on app sales, citing revenue losses at Meta since Apple tightened its privacy policies. Zuckerberg also expressed interest in monetizing WhatsApp and improving Reels, but did not comment on Meta's decision to allow former US President Donald Trump back onto Facebook.

images.alt_text: Apple’s annual data covers more than 600 locations among its top suppliers, which represent 98 per cent of Apple’s direct spending.

site_title: Crypto exchange Binance hires Donald Trump’s audit firm Mazars
summary: Binance, a major cryptocurrency exchange, has hired Mazars, the audit firm led by Donald Trump's former company, to verify its token reserves. This move comes after the collapse of FTX and increased demand for transparency from crypto exchanges. Binance has disclosed its holdings of major tokens and plans to share more data in a "full audited report." Mazars will review public information and verify future updates, with the first verification update for Bitcoin expected to be completed this week.

site_title: Hackers dump more customer data from Australian insurer Medibank
summary: Hackers behind the Medibank cyberattack, attributed to Russia, have released more customer data, including mental health and alcohol use records, on the dark web. The data, totaling almost 10 million customers, was initially compromised in a November attack. Medibank's CEO stated that the released data is incomplete and hard to understand, and the company's work is not over. The hackers claimed "case closed" in a recent blog post, but Medibank continues to investigate and address the situation.

site_title: Mining needs to address critical digital skills shortage right now: BHP executive
summary: BHP Group's chief technology officer, Laura Tyler, warns that the mining industry faces a critical digital skills shortage, competing with tech giants like Google and Amazon for talent. The industry needs 21% more mining engineers and 29% more metallurgists by 2040, according to a PwC analysis. To address this, BHP has increased efforts to attract new workers, including a successful First Year Intern program and a reentry program for former industry workers. However, more needs to be done to ensure the industry remains competitive.

site_title: South Korea steps closer to arrest of Terraform co-founder Shin
summary: South Korean prosecutors are seeking arrest warrants for Terraform Labs co-founder Daniel Shin, along with seven others, on charges including fraud, breach of duty, and illegal fund-raising. The warrants are related to the $60 billion cryptocurrency wipeout caused by the collapse of the TerraUSD stablecoin and its sister token Luna in May. Shin's lawyers claim he was not involved in Terra operations since 2020, and he denies profiting from the alleged illegal sales of the Luna token. A court hearing is scheduled for December 2 to decide on the warrants.

images.alt_text: Kwon created a pair of tokens, an algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD that was meant to have a constant US$1 value but the project suffered a spectacular US$60 billion wipeout in May, roiling the global crypto market and shocking regulators.

site_title: SoftBank taps yield-hungry retail investors in Japan bond market
summary: SoftBank Group raised 385 billion yen (S$3.8 billion) from retail investors in Japan through a seven-year bond with a 2.84% coupon, higher than its previous subordinated note. This sale, along with others by Renault and Rakuten Group, is expected to boost annual retail bond volumes in Japan to its highest in at least three years. Retail investors are attracted to bonds offering higher yields, as they are less affected by market fluctuations, and are drawn to companies with strong brand names like SoftBank.

images.alt_text: Paytm is among a number of Indian startups that went public last year amid a boom in IPOs and zest for the country’s tech sector that have since suffered a slump in market value.
SoftBank Group has made huge bets to find and grow new tech ventures around the world, making its earnings vulnerable to fickle market forces.

site_title: Gold hits 2-week high on hopes of smaller US rate hikes
summary: US gold futures rose 1.7% to $1,788.90, reaching a two-week high, after US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech reinforced expectations of smaller interest rate hikes, boosting gold prices. Spot gold also increased 0.4% to $1,775.77 per ounce, its highest level since November 16. The price surge is seen as a positive sign for the metal, which has been volatile due to interest rate decisions.

images.alt_text: US gold futures fell 0.1 per cent to US$1,746.80.

site_title: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried says he ‘didn’t ever try to commit fraud’
summary: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of the collapsed crypto exchange FTX, denied committing fraud in his first public appearance since the company's collapse. He claimed he did not knowingly commingle customer funds with funds at his proprietary trading firm, Alameda Research. However, Reuters reported that at least $1 billion in customer funds vanished after $10 billion was secretly moved from FTX to Alameda Research. Bankman-Fried attributed the discrepancy to a "confusing internal labeling" and said he doesn't think he has any criminal liability.

images.alt_text:
FTX Trading Ltd and its entities filed for protection under the US Chapter 11 regime. As a result, any court suit or arbitration claims made by investors against these FTX entities would likely be suspended in favour of the insolvency framework. 
Even if investors have a judgment sum or arbitration award against FTX, that could at best be a ticket to queue up in the insolvency process.
On Wednesday, Genesis Global Capital suspended customer redemptions in its lending business.
Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance Lawrence Wong said that the intrisic value of cryptocurrency is zero and investors must be prepared to lose all their money,
Temasek said investing in FTX was part of its effort to keep abreast of how new technologies might affect its portfolio's returns
Kraken had recently expanded quickly, and the cuts will return its workforce to where it was a year ago.

site_title: Singapore shares upbeat at Thursday’s open; STI gains 0.6%
summary: Singapore shares rose 0.6% on Thursday, following Wall Street's gains after the Fed signaled a more modest rate hike. The Straits Times Index reached 3,310.79 at 9 am, with Advancers outpacing Decliners 117 to 15. Sembcorp Marine and Yangzijiang Financial Holding led the gains, while Adventus declined 12.5%. Local banks DBS, UOB, and OCBC also rose, following a positive US market day, where the Dow Jones rose 2.2% and the S&P 500 gained 3.1%.

images.alt_text: Yong Hui Ting
CDL sales slow in its third quarter on low inventory of unsold units and no new launches during the period.

site_title: Stocks to watch: CDL, Sinar Mas Land, Digital Core Reit, Vertex Tech
summary: City Developments Limited (CDL) saw sales slow in its third quarter due to low inventory and no new launches. CDL shares rose 0.4% to S$8.29. Sinar Mas Land is developing a large mixed-use development in Jakarta, while Digital Core Reit is acquiring a data centre in Frankfurt with a 100% debt-funded deal. Vertex Technology Acquisition Corp (VTAC) shares remained unchanged at S$4.52 after Morgan Stanley disposed of some shares.

site_title: Indian tycoon Adani finalises takeover of broadcaster NDTV
summary: Indian tycoon Gautam Adani has finalized a hostile takeover of leading news broadcaster NDTV, securing a majority stake with a 64.71% ownership. The move has sparked concerns over press freedom in India, where the country's ranking in global press freedom has slipped 10 places under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rule. Adani has pledged to guarantee editorial independence, but critics worry about the potential influence of the government on journalism.

images.alt_text: Billionaire Gautam Adani is known for being bullish about India's prospects, often dovetailing his corporate strategy with nation-building priorities.

site_title: Stocks to watch: Japfa, Manulife US Reit, EC World Reit
summary: Japfa's diary-focused subsidiary AustAsia Group begins trading on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong on Friday, with its offering of 30.6 million shares oversubscribed 1.16 times. Manulife US Reit's real estate valuation fell 10.9% to US$1.9 billion, and its aggregate leverage is expected to be 49%, within the 50% limit imposed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. EC World Reit's existing bank loans are expected to be repaid or refinanced before they become due, according to its manager.

site_title: Hong Kong offshore yuan deposit pool to get boost from China’s reopening
summary: Hong Kong's offshore yuan deposit pool rose 0.8% in November to 892.3 billion yuan, marking the fourth consecutive month of growth. Analysts expect further growth as Chinese visitors return in January, seeking offshore investments. The deposit pool now accounts for about 6% of Hong Kong's total banking deposits. The growth is driven by increased yuan trade settlement and the introduction of yuan-denominated stocks on the Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing, set to launch in 2023.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Chinese Yuan banknotes are seen in this illustration taken February 10, 2020. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

site_title: Dalvey bungalow fetches eye-watering S$85,000 monthly rent
summary: A luxury landed home in Dalvey Estate, Singapore, has fetched a record-breaking monthly rental of S$85,000, equivalent to S$1.02 million annually. This is part of a "red-hot" rental market for residential homes, with landed property rents rising 10.9% in Q3 2022. The trend is expected to continue, with high net-worth foreigners seeking luxury homes, driven by Singapore's status as a safe haven amidst geopolitical tensions.

images.alt_text: The same site was put up for sale in January 2021 for S$68 million, pointing to a 55 per cent jump in asking price in under two years.

This old house in Astrid Hill for which Ng has been granted an option to purchase has a freehold land area of nearly 27,700 square feet.

source: GOOGLE MAPS
This house on 17,905 sq ft of land in Tanglin Hill and completed in 1997 is currently on the market with an asking price of S$52 million or S$2,904 psf.

site_title: How Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg and the world’s 500 richest billionaires lost US$1.4t in a year
summary: The world's 500 richest billionaires lost a combined $1.4 trillion in 2022, with some individuals experiencing significant declines in their net worth. Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Changpeng Zhao, and Mark Zuckerberg saw their cumulative net worth erased by $392 billion. The losses were attributed to various factors, including alleged fraud by Sam Bankman-Fried, Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and widespread inflation and central bank tightening. However, some billionaires, such as Gautam Adani, India's richest person, and the Koch and Mars families, added to their fortunes.

images.alt_text: Billionaires have the most positive outlook on the energy sector and Asia economies for the next five years.

site_title: Manulife US Reit gearing a whisker shy of 50% regulatory limit after asset valuation decline
summary: Manulife US Reit's real estate valuation has declined by 10.9% to $1.9 billion due to higher discount rates and capitalisation rates for certain properties. This decline is attributed to a volatile macroeconomic environment and idiosyncratic risks at the property level. The portfolio's performance has also been weakened by continued low occupational performance in submarkets where the properties are located.

images.alt_text: The manager attributes the decline in occupancy largely to Quinn Emanuel’s downsizing of about 71,000 sq ft at its Figueroa property (above).
Two of Manulife US Reit's biggest tenants are giving up space at Figueroa, a Grade A office building in Los Angeles..
William David Gantt III, also known as Tripp Gantt, chief executive of Manulife US Real Estate Management -- the manager of Manulife US Reit

For Manulife US Reit's next mile, new CEO Tripp Gantt is looking to increase the proportion of tenants that are in high-growth markets or come from sectors with secular tailwinds, such as technology and information services.

site_title: Australia business investment dips in Q3, outlook still solid
summary: Australia's business investment declined 0.6% in the September quarter, missing forecasts of a 1.5% increase. Private capital spending fell due to miners cutting back on new equipment. Despite this, firms reaffirmed plans to spend A$155.7 billion in the year ahead, a 5.6% increase from the previous estimate. This upgrade in spending plans aligns with analyst expectations and suggests a solid outlook for the year.

images.alt_text: A cruise makes its way into Sydney Harbour as sails of the Sydney Opera House are illuminated by a projection of poppies during a Remembrance Day Dawn Service in Sydney on November 11, 2022. (Photo by Saeed KHAN / AFP)

site_title: Mortgage rates in the US rise for first time in seven weeks
summary: US mortgage rates rose for the first time in seven weeks, increasing to 6.42% for a 30-year, fixed loan, according to Freddie Mac. This marks the highest rate since early this month, as borrowing costs tracked 10-year Treasury yields, which climbed after a report showed a cooling consumer-price gauge. The Federal Reserve's policy of interest-rate hikes is likely to continue into the new year due to inflation still being higher than desired and wage growth remaining robust.

site_title: EU gives guarded welcome to US guidance on EV tax credits
summary: The European Commission has welcomed US guidance on electric vehicle (EV) tax credits, allowing EU companies to partially benefit from the US Inflation Reduction Act. The guidance states that commercial clean vehicles made by qualified manufacturers can receive tax credits, but vehicles sold to private consumers are not eligible. The Commission expressed a guarded welcome, noting further improvements are required to address concerns that the US law could make the US a world leader in the EV market at the expense of European countries.

images.alt_text: Tesla last week doubled a US new-car price cut to US$7,500 for Model Ys and Model 3s delivered this year, adding to investor jitters about softening demand.

site_title: South Korea’s chip output falls most since global financial crisis
summary: South Korea's semiconductor production in November fell by 15% from a year earlier, the largest drop since the 2009 global financial crisis. This decline, for the fourth straight month, points to a cooling of overseas demand for tech components as the world economy slows. Industrial production contracted 3.7% from a year earlier, the biggest fall since the start of the pandemic. The weakening chip demand adds to concerns over Korea's economic outlook, which is already under pressure from falling exports and rising interest rates at home.

images.alt_text: South Korea’s trade balance is set to remain in deficit for a ninth consecutive month.

site_title: Asia Grand makes a comeback with familiar Cantonese cooking
summary: Asia Grand Restaurant has reopened at Fairmont Singapore with a familiar Cantonese menu, but the food has been underwhelming. The restaurant's new decor still looks dated, but attentive service helps compensate. Key dishes, such as braised garoupa fish head and pork belly, show promise, while others, like char siew so and mango cream, fall short. Overall, the kitchen needs to improve to meet expectations, but the loyal customer base and classic dishes will give it a chance to strengthen its staying power. Rating: 6/10.

images.alt_text: Elan's cosy interiors.

site_title: US: Dow opens higher on easing China Covid curbs; Tesla weighs on Nasdaq
summary: US stocks opened higher on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones rising 20.30 points, or 0.06%, to 33,224.23, following China's relaxation of Covid-19 curbs. The S&P 500 opened lower, and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 35.68 points, or 0.34%, due in part to Tesla's decline.

site_title: Bubbles (what else?) to ring in the new year
summary:
Here is a 100-word or less summary of the article content:

The article highlights the versatility of sparkling wine beyond celebrations and festive occasions. It suggests that sparkling wines, including Champagne, can be paired with a wide variety of foods and are not limited to special occasions. The article recommends 13 sparkling wines, including non-Champagne options, that are available at affordable prices. It emphasizes that while Champagne can be expensive, there are many other great sparkling wines made outside of the Champagne region that offer similar quality at lower prices. The article encourages readers to explore these options and discover their own favorite sparkling wines.

images.alt_text: These six volumes, all published in 2022, are illuminating, surprising and just plain useful guides to better understanding wine and spirits.

site_title: Mapletree Logistics Trust to sell ‘outdated’ Changi property for S$22 million
summary: Mapletree Logistics Trust has agreed to sell its 23-year-old cargo lift warehouse on 3 Changi South Lane to Nova Furnishing Holdings for S$22 million, representing a 39.2% premium to its latest valuation of S$15.8 million. The sale is part of the Reit's manager's rejuvenation strategy, as the warehouse's specifications are considered outdated and inefficient for today's logistics users. The transaction is expected to complete by the fourth quarter of the Reit's 2022/23 financial year and will improve the Reit's financial flexibility to pursue higher yield or growth opportunities.

images.alt_text: Aims Apac Reit reported higher H1 FY2023 gross revenue and net property income.  This was supported by the acquisition of Australian supermarket and grocery chain Woolworths’ headquarters, and higher rental income and recoveries from the Singapore portfolio.
VivoCity shopping mall
Even without acquisition growth, Singapore-listed Reits merit serious consideration if organic growth drivers deliver.

site_title: US charges accused Mango crypto manipulator with fraud
summary: US prosecutors have charged Avraham Eisenberg with commodities fraud and manipulation, alleging he stole approximately $110 million from investors on the Mango Markets cryptocurrency exchange in October by rigging the exchange's futures market. Eisenberg's trades artificially inflated the price of Mango's token MNGO, allowing him to withdraw funds from other investors' deposits. The case is separate from a settlement reached between Mango and Eisenberg, in which the exchange agreed to recoup $67 million.

site_title: Oil explorer Inpex to merge Tokyo trading unit into Singapore desk
summary: Inpex Corp plans to merge its Tokyo trading unit into its Singapore desk in April 2024, integrating operations in stages. The move aims to expand crude oil marketing channels in Asia, responding to diversified customer demands. The Tokyo trading business will be rebased, with 30 employees transferred to the Singapore desk, and operations will be strengthened. The company did not disclose the number of staff at the Singapore operation. The integration is expected to enhance Inpex's presence in the region, where energy demand is expected to grow.

site_title: Europe: Shares end higher on China recovery optimism
summary: European shares rose 0.1% on Tuesday, boosted by optimism over China's recovery from Covid-19 curbs. The Stoxx 600 index gained, with luxury firms like LVMH and Richemont rising 1.7-2.4%. Energy stocks also advanced, driven by oil price increases. Despite thin trading volumes, analysts expect a "minor boost to equity markets" from Chinese reopening and US inflation data. However, some warn that a fast reopening can be double-edged, and shares in Leonteq fell 5.4% after reducing profit expectations.

site_title: Toyota produces record number of vehicles but shortages loom
summary: Toyota produced a record 833,104 vehicles in November, a 1.5% increase from last year, driven by solid consumer demand in North America and a rebound from Covid-impacted supply chains in 2022. However, the company warned of an uncertain outlook due to persistent semiconductor shortages and rising Covid cases in China. Despite this, Toyota maintained its conservative profit outlook. Global sales rose 2.9% to 796,484 units, with domestic output declining 3.3% and overseas output increasing 3.8%.

images.alt_text: The Mirai even removes 99.5 per cent of PM2.5, the ultra-fine soot that is known to harm human health.
Morizo, the alter ego of Toyota President Akio Toyota, greets the crowd before the start of the Idemitsu 1500 at the Chang International Circuit in Buriram, Thailand.

site_title: On-demand platforms may exit markets, undertake strategic M&A in 2023
summary: On-demand platforms, including ride-hailing and food delivery services, may exit markets or sell off assets in 2023 due to rising cost pressures, according to experts. Companies like Grab, led by Anthony Tan, are expected to benefit from consolidation, while others, such as Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, face pressure to turn a profit. Analysts predict a 85% reduction in contribution margin for platforms due to new regulations, prompting companies to reassess their strategies, including acquiring taxis or adopting more asset-light approaches.

images.alt_text: “Deliveroo is today announcing that it has decided to end its operations in Australia,” a statement said.
FoodPanda rider on his bicycle at Northpoint mall, Yishun on Feb 24, 2022.
CEO Anthony Tan says South-east Asia has not, and will not, be spared from rising prices and interest rates, and the consequent effects on growth.

site_title: Hong Kong airport’s robobus offers glimpse of driverless future
summary: Hong Kong International Airport (HKIA) is ready to use driverless buses, with extensive trials and no accidents over 130,000 kilometers. The airport has adapted an electric bus from Chinese carmaker BYD and tested Level 4 autonomous technology, featuring cameras, sensors, and GPS locators. HKIA plans to use the technology to shuttle passengers around the aerodrome from next year, with the goal of having all ground transport electric by 2030 and alleviating labor shortages.

site_title: Singtel to build first data centre in Indonesia with Telkom, Medco Power
summary: Singtel has partnered with Telkom and Medco Power to build its first data centre in Indonesia, marking the telco's entry into the country's data centre market. The hyperscale data centre, located in Batam, will have a total capacity of 51 megawatts and deliver 20 megawatts in the initial phase. The project is part of Singtel's regional data centre strategy to address digital infrastructure demand in the Asia-Pacific region.

images.alt_text: Singtel to build data centres in Thailand with Gulf Energy, AIS
Singtel looks to streamline its operations to stay relevant and maximise shareholder returns.
Data centres, 5G and technology are possible re-ratings catalysts for telcos

site_title: Epicurean find: More value from less food?
summary: A study found that labeling food with multisensory descriptions, known as epicurean labeling, can encourage people to eat less while enjoying the meal more. In a series of studies, participants who received epicurean labels consumed 17% less food and valued the experience at 16% more than those who received standard labels. The labeling approach was also found to be effective in increasing overall pleasure and satisfaction. The findings suggest that food marketers can leverage this approach to promote smaller portions and increase customer satisfaction, benefiting both health and business.

images.alt_text: Japan professor creates 'tele-taste' TV screen
Tetsuya Wakuda learns about acerola cherries from farmer Tetsuko Namisato.
